Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; PAINTED
Name: Support of a vase
Description: This ceramic of the Meroitic Period is characterised amongst others by the general absence of objects with flat bases, which explains the presences of numerous receptacle stands found in the necropoleis of the capital Meroe. The piece from Brussels comes from the excavation by J. Garstang in 1909-1910. Painted in red, the clay stand has no decoration, but the foot is embellished with multiple points in white colour. The lower part is also occupied by four vertical lines on one horizontal.
